text: why does it always feel hotter when it's
humid it has to do with how your body
interacts with the air around it you see
humidity is a measure of the amount of
water vapor in the air the more humid it
is the less efficient your body is at
cooling itself off and here's why
when it's hot you sweat heat from your
body warms up the sweat causing it to
evaporate from your skin the result is a
cooler happier you but humidity messes
up this process when the humidity is
high water in the form of sweat can't
evaporate from your body as fast this
tracks the heat near your skin making
you feel hotter than it actually is
and increasing the chance of a
heatstroke here's an example of just how
bad it can get on an 88 degree day with
a humidity of just 40% it feels like
it's 88 but if the humidity Rises to 85%
it's going to feel like a whopping 110
degrees
ouch that's why weather forecasters use
a heat index to give that feels like
temperature on those hot sweaty days you
can help your body wick away the sweat
by wearing sports fabrics like polyester
a specialized fabric channel's the sweat
from your skin taking the water and heat
away just don't wear cotton it'll trap
the moisture and keep your body from
cooling off now get out there and enjoy
the summer days
